title: [Large-scale] Comparative Study of Physical Education Teaching Methods: Exploring Socio-Physical Competency Development Through Learner-Centered Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational sports education theory, practical experience, and basic understanding of social interaction and collaborative learning principles
context.additional_context: A comparative and analytical process for professional workers to examine applicable physical education methodologies in their work, focusing on enhancing learners' social competencies and considering cultural diversity.

learning_goals: Explain the theoretical foundations and key differences between TGfU (Teaching Games for Understanding) and CLA (Cooperative Learning Approach) from a social interaction perspective.
Propose ≥3 learner-centered physical education design strategies and suggest ways to foster collaboration, critical thinking, and citizenship through them.

Demonstrate constraint analysis and modified game design methods applicable to real educational scenarios, and construct activities reflecting learners’ cultural backgrounds and social relational elements.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
